title: The River of Life
shortSummary: Revelation 22 reveals the final vision of the eternal state, highlighting the pure river of life flowing from God's throne, the tree of life, and the absence of curse and darkness. It concludes with Christ’s promise of His soon return, a call to obedience, and a solemn warning against altering the prophecy.
timeline: c. AD 95 - The Apostle John's Revelation on the Isle of Patmos

keyCharacters.name: John
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of Revelation who receives and records the vision of the end times.

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: The Lamb, the Alpha and Omega, who reveals the prophecy, promises His return, and offers eternal life.

keyCharacters.name: Angel
keyCharacters.description: The heavenly messenger sent by God to show John the visions and instruct him regarding worship and prophecy.

definitions.definition: A symbolic tree in the New Jerusalem bearing twelve kinds of fruit monthly, representing eternal life and healing.
Titles of Christ signifying He is the beginning and the end, encompassing all things in time and eternity.
A metaphor for the eternal life and spiritual sustenance freely given by God to all who believe.
To close or protect the prophecy from being revealed; here, John is instructed not to seal the words, indicating their imminent fulfillment.

outline.heading: The River and Tree of Life
outline.description: John describes the pure river of life flowing from God's throne and the tree of life bearing fruit monthly, symbolizing eternal sustenance and healing. The absence of curse and night emphasizes the perfect, eternal fellowship with God.

outline.heading: The Faithfulness of the Prophecy
outline.description: The angel confirms the truthfulness of the prophecy and urges readiness, emphasizing the certainty of Christ’s imminent return and the fixed spiritual condition of individuals.

outline.heading: Christ’s Promise and Authority
outline.description: Jesus declares His coming with reward, identifies Himself as the Alpha and Omega, and invites obedience to His commandments to gain access to eternal life.

outline.heading: Invitation and Warning
outline.description: The Spirit and the bride invite all to freely receive the water of life, while a solemn warning forbids adding to or taking away from the prophecy, underscoring the sacredness of God’s Word.

outline.heading: Final Benediction and Assurance
outline.description: Jesus affirms His imminent return, and John responds with a prayer for His coming. The chapter closes with a blessing of grace upon all believers.

application: Live in constant readiness for Christ’s return by faithfully keeping His commandments and embracing His promises.
Receive the free gift of eternal life by responding to the Spirit’s invitation with faith and repentance.
Respect and uphold the integrity of Scripture, avoiding any additions or subtractions to God’s revealed Word.
Find hope and encouragement in the assurance that God’s presence will dispel all darkness and bring eternal healing and peace.

keyVerses.text: And, behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his work shall be.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the certainty and imminence of Christ’s return and the righteous judgment that accompanies it.

keyVerses.text: And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that heareth say, Come. And let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the universal invitation to salvation and the freely offered gift of eternal life through Christ.

keyVerses.text: For I testify unto every man that heareth the words of the prophecy of this book, If any man shall add unto these things, God shall add unto him the plagues that are written in this book:
keyVerses.significance: This solemn warning stresses the inviolability of the prophetic Word and the serious consequences of tampering with Scripture.

keyVerses.text: He which testifieth these things saith, Surely I come quickly. Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus.
keyVerses.significance: This verse expresses the blessed hope of Christ’s swift return and the believer’s eager anticipation for His coming.
